entry.title: Combined summary - BIP 0021 idea: sendmany
entry.summary: Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency based on blockchain technology that was created in 2009 by an unknown person or group using the name Satoshi Nakamoto. Despite its potential to revolutionize the financial industry and create a more democratic financial system, it has faced several challenges over the years. One of the main issues is its high volatility, which makes it a risky investment for some people. Additionally, Bitcoin has been associated with illegal activities such as money laundering and drug trafficking. The email thread discusses a specific use case of the percentage slider for Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) that extends 21. However, Wladimir suggests that a new BIP needs to be written to extend BIP 21, and any syntax will do. The email also includes an advertisement for New Relic, a SaaS-based application performance monitoring service.The author proposes a new bitcoin URI scheme for the simplest way to perform a transaction with multiple outputs. The proposed format includes labels and addresses, which keeps them together for human readability. The label delimiter "/" is a reserved character, making it easy for bitcoin clients to parse. The author also discusses the potential failure modes and how to guard against them. Lastly, the author provides some examples and testing results with MultiBit.
